text: Anyone else had any experience with [[Selvala's Stampede]]? It's been disgusting every time I've cast it, but I never see anyone running it.

attachments.fallback: Selvala's Stampede {4}{G}{G} // Sorcery // Council's dilemma — Starting with you, each player votes for wild or free. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card for each wild vote. Put those creature cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle the rest into your library. You may put a permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield for each free vote.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
_Council's dilemma_ — Starting with you, each player votes for wild or free. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card for each wild vote. Put those creature cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle the rest into your library. You may put a permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield for each free vote.
attachments.title: Selvala's Stampede {4}{G}{G}

text: I dig it. I played it in my ug ezuri and then decided to put another in omnath too.
I've run it before. I'm not sure if it's in anything right now or now
Not
I've cast it a couple times, been good
I love the new vote cards from conspiracy 2. They're all fun
Hopefully in Conspiracy 3 we get a voting commander. I would dig it.
That would be pretty great
Council's Judgement is always fun, too. People still mess up regularly
I love getting two or more things with that card.
It's been great every time I've seen it cast...I don't own one, but need to get some.
I have an extra, Henry
Let me know what you want for trades.
I'm surprised it's all of $1.50
Got an extra Skyshroud Claim?
Hrm...no, I need to buy more of those.
Lol
Claim just gets better and better with every dual with basic land types they release
Eh, I'm not sure in the 1.50 range. It's cheap enough that I'd might be easier to pick it up as a single at your shop.
Dana, yup. I need to pick some more up
Yup...the shipping makes it less viable.
Yeah, exactly
Otherwise, look me up next time you're in Rochester.
Wow...Selvalla's Stampede is $11.50 in foil.
A lot of that set in foil has a crazy multiplier.
Look at any of the legends.
And plenty of the rares. It just wasn't opened enough.
Grenzo is 12 in foil, 3 regular.
Marchesa is 8 regular, 80 foil
Selvala is 11 regular, 67 foil
Subterranean tremors is 3 regular, 12 foil
And these boxes are 90 or less.
I feel like we should be buying them.
Draft cards in rare slots fucks up box value
That's true.
IIRC like 1 in 3 packs have a draft card in the rare slot
Still. Draft it for fun. Then use and /or sell off the good shit.
Con 2 seems a solid investment
It's cheap enough.
Yea, I only got to do 1 draft of it and it was fun
If you can snag a box for less than 90 it's a pretty good buy.
Especially with all the mythics being kinda hard to reprint in many places.
Yeah...and most of the mythics being so damn good.
So fucking good.
ban-worthy good :wink:
Even if you open a Leovold and you only play edh, darn. You can trade for most of a deck
Anyone else use [[Capital Punishment]]?

attachments.fallback: Capital Punishment {4}{B}{B} // Sorcery // Council's dilemma — Starting with you, each player votes for death or taxes. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each death vote and discards a card for each taxes vote.
attachments.text:

_Council's dilemma_ — Starting with you, each player votes for death or taxes. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each death vote and discards a card for each taxes vote.
_"I did offer them a choice . . ." —Queen Marchesa_

text: I've never seen one in the wild
No...it's pretty expensive for the effect and it's been disappointing every time I've seen it cast.
I've seen it cast to great effect.
One player wanted sac, but everyone else voted cards. It hurt both ways, but she was extra salty.
I should put it in more decks
Especially Vial Smasher
I bought into [[expropriate]] when it was $3. I got a foil for like 15 when the set first dropped. That card has been amazing for me in all sorts of decks.

attachments.fallback: Expropriate {7}{U}{U} // Sorcery // Council's dilemma — Starting with you, each player votes for time or money. For each time vote, take an extra turn after this one. For each money vote, choose a permanent owned by the voter and gain control of it. Exile Expropriate.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
_Council's dilemma_ — Starting with you, each player votes for time or money. For each time vote, take an extra turn after this one. For each money vote, choose a permanent owned by the voter and gain control of it. Exile Expropriate.
_Few things are more valuable than time or money—and Leovold has plenty of both._
attachments.title: Expropriate {7}{U}{U}

text: Expropriate is nutty in every scenario I've seen it
It basically reads "win the game" a large percentage of the time

In Lazav it has a crazy high win percentage for me. I think there's only once that I didn't win after it resolved, and even then it was almost impossible for the table to bounce back from the damage I had done. It's my favorite card in the deck not named Mindcrank.
We all know that extra turns are a crutch...
Absolutely. It's the only card in that deck that does it too. I feel dirty when I cast it but the shenanigans that follow are just too good to pass up.
Such Star Wars.
Unkown :laughing:
Played Edgar last night with a proxied Legion's Landing. It's so, so easy to flip it feels like cheating. I had it out three times and flipped it the turn it landed twice and the next turn once.
heads
[[Legion's Landing]] is one of the few singles i'm going to buy for my Edgar. I'm trying to downsize my collection, not increase it, but this is too good

text: I agree with Dana, it's so freaking cool with Curio, but at that point it's almost just win more
And lots of mana
It's a way to draw cards in a creature-centric Mardu deck, I can't see a reason not to run it
I'm going to, but that was more I understand if people don't.
In my particular deck I found I wanted stuff that put cards in hand immediately, particularly on turns 3-5
That said, even though I'm not running it now I could entirely change my mind down the road. It's certainly strong.
Hype Check later :stuck_out_tongue:
Tonight I finally got to win a game with [[Torment of Hailfire]]. X = 20 and my three opponents just scoop. It was a lot more satisfying than I expected.

text: It's quite decent, but I had much higher hopes
It's just decent, and at times it's awkward to utilize

Maybe elves since you probably won't have decent small, consistent refilling draw, but the decks I've ran it in I just tend to not have the mana free to utilize it. I thought it was gonna be such value, and it's just fine.
Torment is the bee's knees
Torment is a win con which is always useful
Yeah lifecrafters is one that I also overhyped, but I still run it in a couple lists.
I haven't tried bestiary yet. Sounds like I won't want to
The scry alone is worth it, but if you play big fatties, then the cantrip-portion becomes a never-attained dream.
It's still fine, but not a staple like I expected.
In mono- or 2-color green decks I've found it a house.
I still love lifecrafter's
buuuuut I'll probably replace it with banner in rats
I dunno, a 3 drop vs a 5 drop? I guess in the long run, Banner is more cost effective
It depends on whether you're tribal or not.
lifecrafter's goes in any creature-heavy deck.
Banner goes in tribal.
Oh, yeah, that's true. Imagine having them both.
On the other hand you have Rishkar's Expertise, which I thought was super strong, and now I think super strong is selling it short
Lifecrafter's is worth its salt in my {{Multani}} deck, but has been cut from all my other green lists.
